news.shortDetail: Rumors spread online about changes in tuition fees.
news.detail: A viral post claimed tuition fees would double starting next year. Officials confirmed this is FALSE and clarified no such policy exists. The Ministry of Education emphasized that any changes to tuition fees would be communicated through official channels and would involve stakeholder consultation. The misinformation spread rapidly on social media, causing unnecessary panic among students and parents. Authorities urge the public to verify information before sharing and to rely on official announcements for updates.

news.shortDetail: Social media post warns of a deadly new strain.
news.detail: Experts confirmed a new variant exists, but WHO stated it is not more deadly than existing ones. The viral post exaggerated risks and caused unnecessary concern among the public. Health officials are monitoring the situation closely and have advised the public to continue following standard precautions. The Ministry of Health reassures that vaccines remain effective, and there is no cause for alarm. Social media users are encouraged to rely on updates from official health organizations.

news.shortDetail: News about eco-friendly farming practices gains attention.
news.detail: The story is TRUE. The award was presented by the Ministry of Agriculture to support eco-friendly initiatives. The farmer implemented innovative irrigation techniques and organic fertilizers, resulting in higher yields and reduced environmental impact. The community has been inspired by these efforts, and several neighboring farms are adopting similar practices. The Ministry plans to expand the program nationwide to encourage more sustainable agriculture.

news.shortDetail: A viral video warns of a disaster hitting Southeast Asia.
news.detail: Seismologists confirmed earthquakes cannot be predicted with exact dates. This claim is FALSE. The video, which has been widely shared, is based on misinterpretation of scientific data. Authorities urge the public not to panic and to rely on official sources for disaster preparedness information. Emergency services remain on alert as a precaution, but there is no credible evidence supporting the prediction.

news.shortDetail: Photos shared of students using AI equipment.
news.detail: TRUE story. The new facility aims to support AI and robotics research with state-of-the-art tools. The lab is equipped with advanced computing resources, 3D printers, and collaborative workspaces. Students and faculty are excited about the opportunities for innovation and hands-on learning. The university hopes to attract partnerships with tech companies and foster a culture of research and development.

comments.text: I saw this on Facebook, thanks for clarifying!
Scary how misinformation spreads so fast.
Great to see recognition for local farmers!
